<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Good morning. </strong>Since it’s bound to be the main topic of Zoom conversations this week, let’s do a 15-second intro on the great mystery of our time: the Utah monolith.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Over a week ago, people spotted a metal monolith about 10–12 ft. tall in a remote section of the Utah desert. No one knows how it got there or why. Then, on Friday night, four men dismantled the monolith and left without a trace, according to a photographer on the scene. </p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>While all that was going on, a similar-looking monolith appeared and subsequently vanished in Romania. </span></li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Marketing stunt? Art project? Aliens? Discuss.</p>

<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">

Highlights include $300/week in federal unemployment benefits and $160 billion for state and local governments. Lowlights include Senate Majority Leader Mitch McConnell </span><span><a href="https://www.cnbc.com/2020/12/01/coronavirus-stimulus-update-senators-to-unveil-relief-bill.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">rejecting it</a></span><span> (he’s circulating his own plan). </span>

<div class="c6 " style="margin-bottom:7px">
<!-- <![endif]-->
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
SOFTWARE
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/12/01/went-dms?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Introducing Slackforce
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<img alt="Slack logo on a cloud " style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC8zMjcxL3NsYWNrX3NhbGVzZm9yY2UuanBnIiwiYnVja2V0Ijoib3Nsby1wcm9kdWN0aW9uIiwiZWRpdHMiOnsicmVzaXplIjp7IndpZHRoIjoxMDAwLCJoZWlnaHQiOm51bGx9fX0=">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Francis Scialabba</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Software-as-a-service pioneer Salesforce <a href="https://www.theverge.com/2020/12/1/21719666/salesforce-slack-acquisition-purchase-announced?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">announced</a> in an earnings call yesterday that it will buy workplace management app Slack for $27.7 billion in cash and stock. So like your friend's new SO you haven't been able to evaluate in person yet, let's pass judgment on this pairing from afar. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">For Salesforce: </strong>Slack <a href="https://www.wsj.com/articles/salesforce-has-held-talks-to-buy-slack-technologies-11606326392?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">will join</a> analytics company Tableau and cloud provider Vlocity in Salesforce's growing stable of business services offerings. Salesforce has been buying up enterprise-oriented companies in a bid to fulfill every workplace need outside of book club—and Slack is Salesforce's biggest purchase to date. </p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>Salesforce bulls say it's bulking up in all the right ways, though some analysts </span><span><a href="https://www.washingtonpost.com/technology/2020/12/01/slack-salesforce-acquisition-faq/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">argue</a></span><span> it may be straying too far from its core business: software for managing sales. </span>
</li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">For Slack: </strong>Camping out under Salesforce's tent means more resources, plus new relationships with c-suites around the world thanks to the behemoth's existing customer base. </p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>With tens of millions forced to work from home, Slack's first half of 2020 was a financial party parrot. But in September it missed earnings expectations and shares tanked 19%. </span></li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>The company went public via direct listing in June 2019 and shares haven't budged much since. It also hasn't turned a profit. </span></li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">No need to worry about your favorite gossip channel disappearing; the WaPo writes that Slack's impressive brand loyalty will likely keep Salesforce from meddling too much in the app you know and love/dread. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Zoom out: </strong>Salesforce and Slack have a common, four-paned enemy: Microsoft. Microsoft's workplace management play, Teams, is an increasingly painful thorn in Slack's side, while Salesforce lost an arm-wrestling match for LinkedIn with Microsoft in 2016. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Bottom line: </strong>Software acquisitions have been <a href="https://www.cnbc.com/2020/11/28/salesforce-slack-would-be-first-big-deal-in-boom-year-for-software.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">as few and far between</a> in 2020 as hugs or concerts. The shift to remote catapulted the industry, inflating valuations and putting potential buyouts out of reach. But added competition, from Google and Zoom as well as Microsoft, brought Slack back down to what Salesforce considered a reasonable price.</p>

<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
HEALTHCARE
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/12/01/cdc-vaccine-panel-votes-prioritize-healthcare-workers-long-term-care-residents?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Priority Boarding: Vaccine Edition
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding-right:15px;padding-bottom:15px;padding-left:15px;padding-top:0px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Covid-19 has changed a lot, particularly our enthusiasm for Tuesday afternoon CDC webcasts. Yesterday, 14 members of the agency's Advisory Committee on Immunization Practices (ACIP) <a href="https://www.npr.org/sections/health-shots/2020/12/01/940700204/should-nursing-home-residents-be-prioritized-for-getting-the-covid-19-vaccine?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">voted on</a> one very important question: <a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/issues/2020/11/28?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Who should get vaccinated first</a>?</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">What they decided: </strong>Phase 1 of Phase 1 is *drumroll please* <a href="https://www.cdc.gov/vaccines/acip/meetings/downloads/slides-2020-11/COVID-04-Dooling.pdf?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">healthcare personnel</a> and long-term care facility (LTCF) residents. Healthcare heroes are a no-brainer, but the other group? Not a simple decision. </p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>LTCF staff and residents, despite making up just 6% of Covid cases, account for 39% of U.S. deaths. But vaccine clinical trials typically include younger, healthier volunteers, so efficacy among groups like nursing home residents is less clear.</span></li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">The next round of Phase 1 will include essential workers, people with underlying health conditions, and adults 65+. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">The vaccine scene: </strong>Pfizer and Moderna have requested emergency use authorization for their Covid-19 vaccines. If the FDA approves both of them, 40 million doses could be available by year-end.  </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Looking ahead...</strong>if CDC Director Robert Redfield approves ACIP's decision, this guidance will be sent to the states. Friday's the deadline for states to decide where to ship their first vaccine orders. </p>

<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
DIVERSITY & INCLUSION
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/12/01/nasdaq-proposes-board-diversity-requirements?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
The Nasdaq Waits for No Man
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<img alt="A photograph of the Nasdaq building lit up at night in Times Square." style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC8zMjcyL25hc2RhcS5qcGciLCJidWNrZXQiOiJvc2xvLXByb2R1Y3Rpb24iLCJlZGl0cyI6eyJyZXNpemUiOnsid2lkdGgiOjEwMDAsImhlaWdodCI6bnVsbH19fQ==">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Getty Images</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Yesterday, Nasdaq <a href="https://apnews.com/article/business-board-of-directors-38bceb1f1579518b5b1d97df5b029569?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">asked</a> the Securities and Exchange Commission if it can require all 3,300+ companies that trade on its exchange to...</p>
<ol>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Publicly disclose diversity statistics about their boards of directors.</span></li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Have at least two diverse directors (one woman, one who identifies as an underrepresented minority and/or LGBTQ).</span></li>
</ol>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">If the SEC says yes..</strong>.boards have two years to bring on at least one diverse director and 2–3 more to hire the second. If they miss the deadline and fail to provide a sufficient explanation of why they missed it, they could get delisted.  </p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Over three-quarters of Nasdaq-listed companies can't meet that benchmark today. </span></li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Big picture: </strong>Corporate America has made <a href="https://www.cbsnews.com/news/nasdaq-corporate-board-diversity-rule/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">slow progress</a> improving diversity at the top. In 2018, women held just 22% of Fortune 500 board seats. From 2010–2018, seats held by Black directors increased just one percentage point to 9%.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">The Nasdaq would be the first major exchange to impose such requirements, but <a href="https://www.npr.org/2020/12/01/940501693/nasdaq-pushes-to-require-corporate-boards-to-add-more-women-and-minorities?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">it's not alone</a> in pushing for board diversity. California requires at least one diverse director for companies headquartered in the state, and Goldman Sachs does as well to underwrite an IPO.</p>

<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
STARTUP
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/12/01/startups-micro-mobility-freight-tech-customer-engagement-announce-deals?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Trendspotting
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<img alt="17 August 2020, Berlin: Electric scooters of the rental provider voi. ar..." style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC8zMjcwL3Njb290ZXJfYXRfdGhlX2JyYW5kZW5idXIuanBnIiwiYnVja2V0Ijoib3Nsby1wcm9kdWN0aW9uIiwiZWRpdHMiOnsicmVzaXplIjp7IndpZHRoIjoxMDAwLCJoZWlnaHQiOm51bGx9fX0=">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Picture Alliance/Getty Images</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Want to spot the hottest industries? Easy—follow the money. Here are a few recent deals from fast-growing sectors. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Micromobility: </strong>Voi, a Swedish scooter rental startup, <a href="https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2020-12-01/voi-s-160-million-raise-shows-investors-still-trust-scooters?srnd=premium&sref=KkPzpZvz&utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">raised $160 million</a> to help it expand in Europe. While U.S. e-scooter hotshots Lime and Bird have struggled this year, Voi is hoping a slower and friendlier approach with city officials will lead to sustainable growth.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">AI:</strong> Many companies say they "use artificial intelligence" to solve problems. Scale AI, which yesterday <a href="https://techcrunch.com/2020/12/01/scale-ai-hits-3-5b-valuation-as-its-turns-the-ai-boom-into-a-venture-bonanza/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">raised $155 million</a> at a monster valuation of $3.5 billion, gives companies the behind-the-scenes tools to help them actually put AI to work. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Freight tech: </strong>Flock Freight, a startup that <a href="https://venturebeat.com/2020/12/01/flock-freight-raises-113-5-million-to-consolidate-truck-freight-shipments-with-algorithms/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">streamlines</a> truck shipments using algorithms, closed a $113.5 million round led by SoftBank's Vision Fund 2. It's one of many well-funded companies looking to disrupt the—how do we put this kindly—<em>mature </em>freight sector. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Customer engagement: </strong>SoftBank (yep, them again) took a <a href="https://techcrunch.com/2020/12/01/softbank-takes-a-690m-stake-in-cloud-based-swedish-crm-company-sinch/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">10.1% stake</a> in Sinch, a cloud-based provider of customer engagement services out of Sweden (yep, them again). With more consumers interacting with brands over the internet, Sinch is the top-performing stock on the Stoxx Europe 600 index this year. </p>

<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">

<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
FOOD
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/12/01/mcrib-returns-mcdonalds-nationwide-rollout?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
You Can Eat This Today If You’d Like
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>

<img alt="McRib" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC8zMjY4L21jcmliLmpwZyIsImJ1Y2tldCI6Im9zbG8tcHJvZHVjdGlvbiIsImVkaXRzIjp7InJlc2l6ZSI6eyJ3aWR0aCI6MTAwMCwiaGVpZ2h0IjpudWxsfX19">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>PAUL J. RICHARDS/AFP via Getty Images</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">The famous McRib <a href="https://www.businessinsider.com/mcdonalds-mcrib-returns-december-2-national-rollout-2020-11?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">returns to McDonald's menus</a> today. Half of you are thinking, "Couldn't care less, that's disgusting," while the other 50% have had this date circled on their calendars for the past few months.  </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">One thing we will say about this polarizing delicacy: This year's rollout is different. While the McRib (a sort of barbecue boneless pork sandwich, if we had to describe it) has temporarily popped up on McDonald's menus for years, it hasn't been introduced <em>nationwide </em>since 2012. Today, it's coming to all 14,400 McDonald's locations in the U.S. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Bottom line: </strong>Everyone says Snapchat pioneered disappearing content but, long before Stories was invented, McDonald's understood how ephemeral products can drive feverish demand. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">+ Did you know: </strong>Germany is the only country that's <a href="https://independenttravelcats.com/mcrib-germany/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">served the McRib</a> all year round. </p>

<td style="padding-right:15px;padding-bottom:15px;padding-left:15px;padding-top:0px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Need a post-holiday reset? </strong><a href="https://www.sakara.com/pages/morningbrew?utm_source=morningbrew&utm_medium=12.2&utm_campaign=msp" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Sakara is offering 20%</a> off their Metabolism Super Powder that can help you debloat after an indulgent meal (or ten). <p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Join the great fintech revolution. </strong><a href="https://invest.trygatsby.com/morningbrew?utm_source=morningbrew&utm_medium=email&utm_campaign=12_2" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Gatsby</a> helps investors leverage the fast-growing options market in a digestible, responsible way. <p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Productivity tip: </strong>Try using the <a href="https://www.eisenhower.me/eisenhower-matrix/?utm_campaign=Recomendo&utm_medium=email&utm_source=Revue%20newsletter" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Eisenhower Matrix</a> to sort out your to-do list. </p>

style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0\"\u003e\nSOFTWARE \n\u003c/h3\u003e\n\u003ch1 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px\"\u003e\n\u003ca href=\"https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/12/01/went-dms?email={{profile.email}}\" target=\"_blank\" style=\"color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;\"\u003e\n\u003cfont color=\"#000000\"\u003e\nIntroducing Slackforce\n\u003c/font\u003e\u003c/a\u003e\n\u003c/h1\u003e\n\u003c/td\u003e\n\u003c/tr\u003e\n\u003c/table\u003e\n\u003cimg alt=\"Slack logo on a cloud \" style=\"display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;\" width=\"670\" class=\"story-header-image\" src=\"https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC8zMjcxL3NsYWNrX3NhbGVzZm9yY2UuanBnIiwiYnVja2V0Ijoib3Nsby1wcm9kdWN0aW9uIiwiZWRpdHMiOnsicmVzaXplIjp7IndpZHRoIjoxMDAwLCJoZWlnaHQiOm51bGx9fX0=\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;\"\u003e\n\u003csmall\u003e\u003cem\u003eFrancis Scialabba\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/small\u003e\n\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"border-collapse: collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding:15px\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eSoftware-as-a-service pioneer Salesforce \u003ca href=\"https://www.theverge.com/2020/12/1/21719666/salesforce-slack-acquisition-purchase-announced?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eannounced\u003c/a\u003e in an earnings call yesterday that it will buy workplace management app Slack for $27.7 billion in cash and stock. So like your friend's new SO you haven't been able to evaluate in person yet, let's pass judgment on this pairing from afar. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eFor Salesforce: \u003c/strong\u003eSlack \u003ca href=\"https://www.wsj.com/articles/salesforce-has-held-talks-to-buy-slack-technologies-11606326392?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ewill join\u003c/a\u003e analytics company Tableau and cloud provider Vlocity in Salesforce's growing stable of business services offerings. Salesforce has been buying up enterprise-oriented companies in a bid to fulfill every workplace need outside of book club—and Slack is Salesforce's biggest purchase to date. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003eSalesforce bulls say it's bulking up in all the right ways, though some analysts \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://www.washingtonpost.com/technology/2020/12/01/slack-salesforce-acquisition-faq/?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eargue\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e it may be straying too far from its core business: software for managing sales. \u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eFor Slack: \u003c/strong\u003eCamping out under Salesforce's tent means more resources, plus new relationships with c-suites around the world thanks to the behemoth's existing customer base. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eWith tens of millions forced to work from home, Slack's first half of 2020 was a financial party parrot. But in September it missed earnings expectations and shares tanked 19%. \u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eThe company went public via direct listing in June 2019 and shares haven't budged much since. It also hasn't turned a profit. \u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eNo need to worry about your favorite gossip channel disappearing; the WaPo writes that Slack's impressive brand loyalty will likely keep Salesforce from meddling too much in the app you know and love/dread. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eZoom out: \u003c/strong\u003eSalesforce and Slack have a common, four-paned enemy: Microsoft. Microsoft's workplace management play, Teams, is an increasingly painful thorn in Slack's side, while Salesforce lost an arm-wrestling match for LinkedIn with Microsoft in 2016. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eBottom line: \u003c/strong\u003eSoftware acquisitions have been \u003ca href=\"https://www.cnbc.com/2020/11/28/salesforce-slack-would-be-first-big-deal-in-boom-year-for-software.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eas few and far between\u003c/a\u003e in 2020 as hugs or concerts. The shift to remote catapulted the industry, inflating valuations and putting potential buyouts out of reach. But added competition, from Google and Zoom as well as Microsoft, brought Slack back down to what Salesforce considered a reasonable price.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c!-- SOCIAL LINKS --\u003e\n\u003ctable href=\"https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/12/01/cdc-vaccine-panel-votes-prioritize-healthcare-workers-long-term-care-residents?email={{profile.email}}\" target=\"_blank\" style=\"color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;\"\u003e\n\u003cfont color=\"#000000\"\u003e\nPriority Boarding: Vaccine Edition\n\u003c/font\u003e\u003c/a\u003e\n\u003c/h1\u003e\n\u003c/td\u003e\n\u003c/tr\u003e\n\u003c/table\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"border-collapse: collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding-right:15px;padding-bottom:15px;padding-left:15px;padding-top:0px\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eCovid-19 has changed a lot, particularly our enthusiasm for Tuesday afternoon CDC webcasts. Yesterday, 14 members of the agency's Advisory Committee on Immunization Practices (ACIP) \u003ca href=\"https://www.npr.org/sections/health-shots/2020/12/01/940700204/should-nursing-home-residents-be-prioritized-for-getting-the-covid-19-vaccine?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003evoted on\u003c/a\u003e one very important question: \u003ca href=\"https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/issues/2020/11/28?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eWho should get vaccinated first\u003c/a\u003e?\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eWhat they decided: \u003c/strong\u003ePhase 1 of Phase 1 is *drumroll please* \u003ca href=\"https://www.cdc.gov/vaccines/acip/meetings/downloads/slides-2020-11/COVID-04-Dooling.pdf?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ehealthcare personnel\u003c/a\u003e and long-term care facility (LTCF) residents. Healthcare heroes are a no-brainer, but the other group? Not a simple decision. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eLTCF staff and residents, despite making up just 6% of Covid cases, account for 39% of U.S. deaths. But vaccine clinical trials typically include younger, healthier volunteers, so efficacy among groups like nursing home residents is less clear.\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eThe next round of Phase 1 will include essential workers, people with underlying health conditions, and adults 65+. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eThe vaccine scene: \u003c/strong\u003ePfizer and Moderna have requested emergency use authorization for their Covid-19 vaccines. If the FDA approves both of them, 40 million doses could be available by year-end.  \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eLooking ahead...\u003c/strong\u003eif CDC Director Robert Redfield approves ACIP's decision, this guidance will be sent to the states. Friday's the deadline for states to decide where to ship their first vaccine orders. \u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c!-- SOCIAL LINKS --\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;\"\u003e\n\u003csmall\u003e\u003cem\u003eGetty collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding:15px\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eYesterday, Nasdaq \u003ca href=\"https://apnews.com/article/business-board-of-directors-38bceb1f1579518b5b1d97df5b029569?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003easked\u003c/a\u003e the Securities and Exchange Commission if it can require all 3,300+ companies that trade on its exchange to...\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003col\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003ePublicly disclose diversity statistics about their boards of directors.\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eHave at least two diverse directors (one woman, one who identifies as an underrepresented minority and/or LGBTQ).\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ol\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eIf the SEC says yes..\u003c/strong\u003e.boards have two years to bring on at least one diverse director and 2–3 more to hire the second. If they miss the deadline and fail to provide a sufficient explanation of why they missed it, they could get delisted.  \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eOver three-quarters of Nasdaq-listed companies can't meet that benchmark today. \u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eBig picture: \u003c/strong\u003eCorporate America has made \u003ca href=\"https://www.cbsnews.com/news/nasdaq-corporate-board-diversity-rule/?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eslow progress\u003c/a\u003e improving diversity at the top. In 2018, women held just 22% of Fortune 500 board seats. From 2010–2018, seats held by Black directors increased just one percentage point to 9%.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eThe Nasdaq would be the first major exchange to impose such requirements, but \u003ca href=\"https://www.npr.org/2020/12/01/940501693/nasdaq-pushes-to-require-corporate-boards-to-add-more-women-and-minorities?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eit's not alone\u003c/a\u003e in pushing for board diversity. California requires at least one diverse director for companies headquartered in the state, and Goldman Sachs does as well to underwrite an IPO.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c!-- SOCIAL LINKS Here are a few recent deals from fast-growing sectors. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eMicromobility: \u003c/strong\u003eVoi, a Swedish scooter rental startup, \u003ca href=\"https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2020-12-01/voi-s-160-million-raise-shows-investors-still-trust-scooters?srnd=premium\u0026sref=KkPzpZvz\u0026utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eraised $160 million\u003c/a\u003e to help it expand in Europe. While U.S. e-scooter hotshots Lime and Bird have struggled this year, Voi is hoping a slower and friendlier approach with city officials will lead to sustainable growth.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eAI:\u003c/strong\u003e Many companies say they \"use artificial intelligence\" to solve problems. It's one of many well-funded companies looking to disrupt the—how do we put this kindly—\u003cem\u003emature \u003c/em\u003efreight sector. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eCustomer engagement: \u003c/strong\u003eSoftBank (yep, them again) took a \u003ca href=\"https://techcrunch.com/2020/12/01/softbank-takes-a-690m-stake-in-cloud-based-swedish-crm-company-sinch/?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003e10.1% stake\u003c/a\u003e in Sinch, a cloud-based provider of customer engagement services out of Sweden (yep, them again).
